Ways To Support
Shop & Dine
Shop & Dine
Blending the entrepreneurial spirit with social responsibility, these ventures not only offer exceptional products and services but also help us fund the mission of St. Matthew’s House.
Ways To Support
Donate Financially
Donate Goods
Volunteer
Shop & Dine
Ways To Support
Donate Financially
Donate Goods
Volunteer
Shop & Dine
Discover hidden treasures and support a local cause at St. Matthew’s House Thrift. Our upscale stores offer an array of name-brand clothing, furniture, home goods, and more at discounted prices!
With new arrivals daily and a welcoming atmosphere, our thrift stores provide a unique shopping experience where you can find great deals while making a positive impact because each purchase you make directly contributes to funding our nonprofit programs.
We also offer free pickup for donations and affordable delivery for when you find something you love and need help getting it home.
Visit us today at one of our many locations across Southwest Florida, or check out our online store through the link below!
Find a Location
Donate Items
Food is a universal language, uniting people and fostering meaningful connections. This theme runs through Delicious By Design catering, a culinary enterprise that began its journey in 2005.
Delicious By Design proudly contributes to the St. Matthew’s House mission through additional purpose-driven initiatives, including outreach meals and a culinary training program.
From intimate family gatherings to grand-scale events, every moment orchestrated by Delicious By Design reflects our shared dedication to community and connection.
Visit Website
Clean and casual, LuLu’s Kitchen has been a choice restaurant for Southwest Florida families since 2020.
Whether you’re looking for a place to get a hearty breakfast or a light lunch, LuLu’s Kitchen offers meals everyone will love!
The menu, crafted by the executive chef and his team, highlights fresh ingredients from Florida in creative ways.
Stop in today and let LuLu’s Kitchen make your day or order online for easy drive-thru pickup.
LuLu’s Kitchen proudly supports St. Matthew’s House earning revenue to offset the organization’s overhead costs.
Visit Website
The
Port LaBelle Inn
is currently
closed for renovations
as we make exciting upgrades to enhance your future stay.
We are
not
accepting new reservations at this time.
Thank you for your patience and support as we invest in a refreshed guest experience. We can’t wait to welcome you back soon with improved amenities and upgraded comfort.
Stay tuned for updates and reopening dates.
1563 Oxbow Dr, LaBelle, FL 33935
(863) 675-4411
[email protected]
Event Space
Elevate your next event at St. Matthew’s House Event Spaces. Our diverse venues offer versatile settings for gatherings such as private meetings, corporate retreats, or dinner parties. Whether you’re planning an intimate celebration or a large-scale event, our dedicated team will work with you to ensure the space is tailored to your needs.
With customizable options and state-of-the-art amenities our event spaces provide the perfect backdrop for unforgettable occasions.
Plus, by choosing our venues, you’re supporting our mission to make a difference in the lives of those in need. Book your event with us today and create memories while giving back to the community!

Careers

Financials
About St. Matthew’s House
®
As an expression of God’s love in Southwest Florida, we are growing to ensure that no one experiencing hunger, homelessness or addiction is alone or without a pathway for their journey from crisis to contributor. Together with our partners and participants, we cultivate communities where people are progressively seen, accepted, challenged, and supported.
Our Guiding Principles
Community Driven
For over 35 years, St. Matthew’s House
®
has tackled challenges born from the needs of Southwest Florida.
Faith Based
St. Matthew’s House
®
endeavors to follow Christ’s instructions outlined in Matthew 25.
Crisis to Contributor
Our programs meet immediate needs while building toward sustainable transformation.
Uniquely Funded
We don’t rely on government funding. Our social enterprise profits defray administrative costs, so donations reach those in need.
Our story
Explore our history
Journey through milestones and meaningful moments over our last 35 years.
1987
St. Matthew’s House began in 1987 when a group of local residents harnessed the power of the Naples Ministerial Association and formed the “Task Force for the Homeless”, which would eventually be renamed St. Matthew’s House. The group began gathering contributions of both food and clothing, establishing the mission’s food pantry.
1989
St. Matthew’s House opened its doors in an old firehouse on Airport Road South. Serving three meals daily and offering eighteen beds, it became known as the “House with a Heart”.
1994
Community support grew and St. Matthew’s House was able to construct additional shelter capacity, more than tripling the beds available for men and also introducing sections for single women and for women with children and infants.
2001
Responding to additional community needs, St. Matthew’s House begins construction of Wolfe Apartments, to serve as affordable transitional housing, and opens Naples Thrift Store to further serve the community and provide an additional source of funding for the organization.
2008
St. Matthew’s House merges with emergency housing shelter Immokalee Friendship House, expanding to include 44 additional beds, along with administrative efficiencies and more services to a larger segment of the population.
2010
With the financial leadership of the Holecek Family Foundation, Justin’s Place Recovery Program opens in response to the need for long-term solutions for the struggles faced by the community’s most at-risk individuals.
2017
The Wright Family partners to open Jill’s Place, the new home for the Jill Wright Retreat Center.
2018
With the continued support of the Holecek Family Foundation, a 5-acre plot of land was purchased and named Justin’s Village in honor of Justin Holecek. The property serves as transitional housing for recovery program graduates and their families.
Additionally, the Naples Shelter is renamed Campbell Lodge in honor of the Campbell family and sets for extensive renovation.
2020
Responding to COVID-19, the St. Matthew’s House food pantry pivots to mobile food distributions and experiences exponential growth in order to meet growing needs.
LuLu’s Kitchen is built and opens later in the year, made possible by the Holecek Family Foundation. LuLu’s Kitchen houses cafe, catering, and mission meal operations.
2022
In response to Hurricane Ian’s devastating impact on southwest Florida, St. Matthew’s House donors, volunteers and staff came together to raise and deploy nearly $2.3 million in hurricane relief to repair damaged St. Matthew’s House facilities and help the community at large rebuild.
2023
Launched the Scott & Dolly McCartan Empowerment Hub, a state-of-the-art learning facility designed to assist Justin’s Place alumni and program participants on their journey to financial stability.
2024
Groundbreaking of new Fort Myers Women and Children’s Shelter, expected to open later this year.

Annual Candlelight Vigil
On the longest night of the year, St. Matthew's House hosts a candlelight vigil to remember those we've lost and find comfort in each other. Held annually on National Homeless Persons’ Memorial Day, we also honor those who are without a home and pray for their safety. Register Now!
